Description: Foot and body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; low ring foot; exterior unslipped, glazed band over lowest wall and outside of foot; interior: white slip, thickly applied; fugitive added red paint; part of an animal's head to right (grazing goat?). Underneath foot light red stripe, probably part of potter's or merchant's mark. Fine brown-reddish clay with small silver mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.490)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
